intro: Hieraciodes arabica, commonly known as the Arabian hill balm, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its small, yellowish to white flowers bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Hieraciodes arabica is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
